{"step_by_step_thinking": "Anodontia is a rare genetic disorder characterized by the congenital absence of all primary or permanent teeth. It does not directly affect the growth of the maxilla, mandible, or cranium. However, it does affect the alveolar bone, which is the thickened ridge of bone that contains the tooth sockets on bones that hold teeth. In the absence of teeth, the alveolar bone does not develop properly.", "answer_choice": "C. Alveolar bone"}
